front.title: A Framework for Reducing Spam for Internet Telephony

abstract.t: Spam, defined as sending unsolicited messages to someone in bulk, might be a problem on SIP open-wide deployed networks. A number of solutions have been proposed for dealing with Spam for Internet Telephony (SPIT), for example, content filtering, black lists, white lists, consent-based communication, reputation systems, address obfuscation, limited use addresses, turing tests, computational puzzles, payments at risk, circles of trust, and many others. This document describes the big picture that illustrates how the different building blocks fit together and can be deployabled incrementally.
